thread.title: Volkswagen’s Müller Is Set to Be Replaced as Auto Giant’s CEO

author: William Boston
title: Volkswagen’s Müller Is Set to Be Replaced as Auto Giant’s CEO
text:
BERLIN—Volkswagen AG’s supervisory board is expected to vote on Friday to replace Chief Executive Matthias Müller with Herbert Diess, a former BMW AG executive who now runs the Volkswagen brand, the German car maker’s biggest business, according to a person familiar with the situation.

Mr. Müller, who formerly ran Volkswagen’s sports-car marque, Porsche AG, became CEO of the company in September 2015 in the wake of the disclosure in the U.S. that Volkswagen had rigged millions of diesel-powered cars to cheat emissions tests.... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
